step.cmd: Remove the mainspring housing from the typewriter by unscrewing the two barrel attachment screws.
Set the housing on a rag, with the metal side of the barrel facing up.
Using the pipette or dropper, apply a few drops of degreaser on and around the center screw and slot.
step.info: Warning: Once the degreaser reaches the mainspring and loosens it, the barrel may jump or pop as the tension in the spring is released.

step.cmd: Use the stiff-bristle brush and soft-bristle brushes as needed to clean any gummed up debris from the center screw.
Spray the barrel with compressed air to further remove loosened debris.
Repeat steps 4 through 6 until the spring barrel is able to rotate easily, while still maintaining some tension.
Once the spring barrel is able to rotate, fully dry the barrel using a lint free cloth and compressed air.
Reattach the spring barrel to the typewriter undercarriage using the two attachment screws.
Reattach the drawband to the spring barrel using the steps outlined in the section below, titled "Reattach the drawband."
